page.title: 02FOXPARK RESERVOIR 1
page.content: High up on Bodmin Moor are two reservoirs, Sibley Back, which holds 650,000,000 gallons of water and the new reservoir, Colliford, when it is full,it will hold ten times that amount. Water is released from the dam into the river Fowey. Further down the river the water is taken into the Restormel Water Works, where it is purified and made fit for drinking. From Restormel the clean water is pumped to the underground storage reservoir on the hill at Foxpark. This reservoir is a concrete box set in the hill which is 665ft above sea level. Foxpark contains 5,000,000 gallons and provides water for Bodmin and the surrounding villages. Foxpark is very important also because is the first stage of the trunk main which takes the water
